data.name: AccessibleStateType
desc: This list of constants defines the available set of states that an object that implements XAccessibleContext can be in.
The comments describing the states is taken verbatim from the Java Accessibility API 1.4 documentation.

We are using constants instead of a more typesafe enum. The reason for this is that IDL enums may not be extended. Therefore, in order to include future extensions to the set of roles we have to use constants here.
These states are giving values corresponding to the bits of a 64-bit value, since we OR them together to create bitsets to represent the combined state of an accessibility object .

items.name: INVALID
lines: Indicates an invalid state.

items.name: ACTIVE
lines: Indicates a window is currently the active window.

items.name: ARMED
lines: Indicates that the object is armed.

items.name: BUSY
lines: Indicates the current object is busy.

items.name: CHECKED
lines: Indicates this object is currently checked.

items.name: DEFUNC
lines: User interface object corresponding to this object no longer exists.
Indicates the user interface object corresponding to this object no longer exists.

items.name: EDITABLE
lines: Indicates the user can change the contents of this object.

items.name: ENABLED
lines: Indicates this object is enabled.

items.name: EXPANDABLE
lines: Indicates this object allows progressive disclosure of its children.

items.name: EXPANDED
lines: Indicates this object is expanded.

items.name: FOCUSABLE
lines: Object can accept the keyboard focus.
Indicates this object can accept keyboard focus, which means all events resulting from typing on the keyboard will normally be passed to it when it has focus.

items.name: FOCUSED
lines: Indicates this object currently has the keyboard focus.

items.name: HORIZONTAL
lines: Indicates the orientation of this object is horizontal.

items.name: ICONIFIED
lines: Indicates this object is minimized and is represented only by an icon.

items.name: INDETERMINATE
lines: Sometimes UI elements can have a state indeterminate.

This can happen e.g. if a check box reflects the bold state of text in a text processor. When the current selection contains text which is bold and also text which is not bold, the state is indeterminate.

items.name: MANAGES_DESCENDANTS
lines: Indicates the most (all) children are transient and it is not necessary to add listener to the children.
Only the active descendant (given by the event) should be not transient to make it possible to add listener to this object and recognize changes in this object.

The state is added to make a performance improvement. Now it is no longer necessary to iterate over all children to find out whether they are transient or not to decide whether to add listener or not. If there is an object with this state no one should iterate over the children to add listener. Only the active descendant should get listener if it is not transient.

items.name: MODAL
lines: Object is modal.
Indicates something must be done with this object before the user can interact with an object in a different window.

items.name: MULTI_LINE
lines: Indicates this (text) object can contain multiple lines of text.

items.name: MULTI_SELECTABLE
lines: More than one child may be selected at the same time.
Indicates this object allows more than one of its children to be selected at the same time.

items.name: OPAQUE
lines: Indicates this object paints every pixel within its rectangular region.

items.name: PRESSED
lines: Indicates this object is currently pressed.

items.name: RESIZABLE
lines: Indicates the size of this object is not fixed.

items.name: SELECTABLE
lines: Object is selectable.
Indicates this object is the child of an object that allows its children to be selected, and that this child is one of those children that can be selected.

items.name: SELECTED
lines: Object is selected.
Indicates this object is the child of an object that allows its children to be selected, and that this child is one of those children that has been selected.

items.name: SENSITIVE
lines: Indicates this object is sensitive.

items.name: SHOWING
lines: Object is displayed on the screen.

An object has set the SHOWING state if itself and all of its parents have set the VISIBLE state and it lies at least partly inside the visible area of its parent. It is, though, not necessarily visible on the screen because it may be occluded by other objects.

items.name: SINGLE_LINE
lines: Indicates this (text) object can contain only a single line of text.

items.name: STALE
lines: Object information is stale and might not be up to date.
Indicates that the information that is returned from this object might be out of sync with the application.

items.name: TRANSIENT
lines: Indicates this object is transient.

items.name: VERTICAL
lines: Indicates the orientation of this object is vertical.

items.name: VISIBLE
lines: Object wants to be displayed on the screen.

A set VISIBLE state indicates that an object wants to be displayed on the screen. It is displayed, as indicated by a set SHOWING state, if all of its parents have also set the VISIBLE state and the object lies at least partly in the visible area of its parent.

items.name: MOVEABLE
lines: Indicates the position of the object is not fixed.

items.name: DEFAULT
lines: Indicates the object is the default button in a window.

items.name: OFFSCREEN
lines: Indicates the object is outside of the screen area.

items.name: COLLAPSE
lines: Indicates that the object is collapsed.

items.name: CHECKABLE
lines: Indicates this object is checkable, i.e.
it has the potential to be checked. See also the CHECKED state.
